> G2 and G3 are created as mutations off of G1.  
> Do the 4->3 connections get the same innovation
> number?
>
> If not, should node additions be incremented globally,
> or at least be tracked by what connection they split 
> as opposed to what new connections they create? 

In our implementation, we tracked it by what connection they split.  
We track and re-use innovation IDs in 2 ways:

1) Connections between 2 neurons with the same innovation IDs always 
get the same innovation ID.  Thus, if a connection evolves between 
nodes 3 and 4 in generation 25 and again in generation 50, those 
connection will have the same innovation ID.

2) Nodes created by replacing a connection with the same innovation 
ID always receive the same connection ID.

Unless I'm mistaken Ken's implementation does something similar to 
this, but the scope is only a single generation not the entire run.  
So, in my #1 example, those connections wuld get different innovation 
IDs, but another connection mutated between nodes 3 and 4 in 
generation 25 would get the same ID.
